1a3cbaca-2b62-4244-bae4-4d084fc9f318.description: Badge earners are have demonstrated a positive trend of recognizing and reporting phishing email simulations and are actively helping to keep the Boeing Company and its employees safe. This badge is available for Boeing internal employees and partners only.
1a3cbaca-2b62-4244-bae4-4d084fc9f318.name: Phish Fighter

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in at least 6 campaigns of Boeing's Self-Phishing program.
Report at least 50% of the Boeing phishing simulations received.
Click fewer than 20% of the Boeing phishing simulations received.

bbf160ba-0f1f-4cea-a9e4-f79c8a186456.description: Badge earners are able to demonstrate that they know the foundations of the Seek, Speak & Listen habits and how they can be applied in their daily work. Badge earners have an awareness and commitment to the Seek, Speak & Listen habits that build stronger teams and better business outcomes at the Boeing Company.
bbf160ba-0f1f-4cea-a9e4-f79c8a186456.name: Seek, Speak & Listen Foundations

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all sections of the SS&L Foundations Degreed pathway.

4381ef18-d048-4ef6-9a4f-2ce900d0b789.description: Badge earners are able to describe the importance of sustainability to the Boeing Company and how it has shaped Boeing’s various enterprise activities.
4381ef18-d048-4ef6-9a4f-2ce900d0b789.name: Boeing Aerospace Sustainability Foundations

badge_template_activities.title: Module 1: What is Sustainability?
Module 2: Why Sustainability Matters to Aerospace
Module 3: Sustainability Starts with Me

f7641402-4d4c-4465-ad4a-1052d2567630.description: Badge earners are able to explain the benefits of Agile Practices and are prepared to apply those practices with their team for improved collaboration and better business results. This badge is for Boeing internal use only.
f7641402-4d4c-4465-ad4a-1052d2567630.name: Agile Collaboration

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Agile for Team Leaders and Managers course.
Complete end of Agile for Team Leaders and Managers course knowledge assessment with a score of 80% or higher.

833cf104-5c39-4fad-ab9b-4489b25bccaa.description: The User-Centered Design (UCD) Advocate badge earner is able to describe User-centered design framework methods including user interviews, brainstorming, storyboarding, prototyping, usability test design and usability testing. Badge earners are able to apply the User-Centered Design framework and tools to future projects with guidance. This badge is currently offered internal to Boeing only.
833cf104-5c39-4fad-ab9b-4489b25bccaa.name: User-Centered Design Advocate

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners may participate in a 4 hour virtual or in-person workshop (leadership version) or 9 hour virtual or in-person workshop. Click the link for scheduling options.

If you have not completed an in-person or virtual workshop, you may instead independently complete the User-Centered Design Advocate pathway in Degreed with successful completion of the knowledge assessment.
Complete User-Centered Design Advocate knowledge assessment with a score of 80% or better.

14f14989-8681-427c-ba13-8d6c8c523b8f.description: The badge earner uses their Business Acumen knowledge to build strong relationships with their internal partners, influence mutually beneficial outcomes for their stakeholders, and align HR strategies and actions to the needs of the business.
14f14989-8681-427c-ba13-8d6c8c523b8f.name: Business Acumen for Human Resources

badge_template_activities.title: The earners will need to pass a 10 question quiz with a score of at least 80% in the Business Acumen Digital Badge for HR pathway in Degreed.

50555017-1d9a-42ce-9d50-8033ace01ae9.description: The badge earner uses their awareness of data and analytics to make connections between their work and other parts of the business. They understand the importance of data and analytics in driving business insights, quality, efficiency, and safety. This badge is available to Boeing employees only.
50555017-1d9a-42ce-9d50-8033ace01ae9.name: Digital Literacy Foundations

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the required elements in the Data and Analytics - Boeing's Digital Future pathway in Degreed.
Successfully complete the end of pathway knowledge assessment with a score of 80% or better.

5540dcd2-a753-4609-8076-0fbfbcdd5f76.description: Badge earners have a general awareness and understanding of Advanced Product Quality Planning (APQP) methodology. This badge is available for Boeing internal use only.
5540dcd2-a753-4609-8076-0fbfbcdd5f76.name: Advanced Product Quality Planning (APQP) Associate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete APQP Associate Degreed pathway.

97b6fe6d-8909-4dae-8910-572876c418d4.description: The Seek, Speak & Listen (SS&L) Advocate badge earners are able to demonstrate that they know the foundations of the Seek, Speak & Listen habits and how to apply them within the context of their work environment (this badge is available for internal Boeing use only).
97b6fe6d-8909-4dae-8910-572876c418d4.name: Seek, Speak & Listen Advocate

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earner completes the Seek, Speak & Listen (SS&L) Advocate Degreed pathway and marks all items complete.
Badge earner builds and executes their SS&L Advocate Action Plan. Marks the Finalize and Execute your SS&L Advocate Action Plan task item complete in Degreed.
Badge earner completes required assessment and passes at 80% or above.

fd3b9fa3-7cf5-4a2c-9ae6-01e9daa60924.description: Badge earners are able to create effective learning experiences using the Degreed platform at Boeing. Badge earners are able to identify and recognize defined standards and best practices for creating quality learning experiences on Boeing's Degreed platform. This badge is for Boeing employees and partners only.
fd3b9fa3-7cf5-4a2c-9ae6-01e9daa60924.name: Learning Plan & Pathway Professional

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all required elements of Designing & Developing Effective Learning Pathways.
Pass the Designing & Developing Effective Learning Pathways assessment with a score of 80% or better.

a4bcb0ff-2ea0-44de-80bf-0a31760efd89.description: The badge earner is able to state the market potential of Boeing services and the strategic importance of the market to Boeing customers. The badge earner will be able to convey to others the differentiation and success factors necessary for long-term Boeing success through the entire lifecycle of products/services including how BGS makes money. This badge is available for Boeing internal use only.
a4bcb0ff-2ea0-44de-80bf-0a31760efd89.name: Services Excellence

badge_template_activities.title: Services Excellence
Pass Services Excellence assessment with a score of 80% or better.

skills.name: How Boeing Global Services make money

bb003dcc-08b4-41f9-a80d-b588e288c16a.description: An APQP Contributor is able to provide data, information or knowledge in support of APQP deliverables. This badge earner is called up on as needed by the team and commits to supporting mitigation action plans as needed. The badge earner demonstrates the ability to remember and understand factual knowledge and may also be requested to participate in a designated project. This badge is for Boeing internal use only.
bb003dcc-08b4-41f9-a80d-b588e288c16a.name: Advanced Product Quality Planning (APQP) Contributor

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the APQP Contributor pathway in Degreed.
Successfully complete the assessment included in the APQP Contributor pathway in Degreed.
Advanced Product Quality Planning (APQP) Associate

1e23ccbc-8ed4-4fdc-858d-28326fba6def.description: The User-Centered Design (UCD) Practitioner badge earner is able to apply User-Centered Design practices to real projects. Badge earners are able to independently conduct user interviews, brainstorm innovative solutions, storyboard ideas, prototype user-experiences, and design, conduct and analyze usability tests. This badge is currently offered internal to Boeing only.
1e23ccbc-8ed4-4fdc-858d-28326fba6def.name: User-Centered Design Practitioner

badge_template_activities.title: The badge earner has demonstrated their ability to apply User-Centered Design practices, including explorative interviews, brainstorming, storyboarding, collaborative prototyping, user test design, usability testing and iteration to a real project. The badge holder is ready to continue to apply the User-Centered Design framework and tools to projects.
User-Centered Design Advocate

8ee30b8d-09b7-47b6-9181-330cdf80c741.description: Boeing Learning Ambassadors are a community of individuals who are passionate about supporting the development of their colleagues across the world. Our Learning Ambassadors span 28 countries, represent all of our business units and act as advocates for our Learning and Development culture.
8ee30b8d-09b7-47b6-9181-330cdf80c741.name: Learning Ambassador - 2022

badge_template_activities.title: This person is recognized as an active Learning Ambassador having applied and been selected for the program and having attended kickoff in Q1 2022.
The member must show active participation through attending a minimum of 3 monthly regional meetings, as well as participating in their respective Focus Groups continuously.

187ed177-73b6-447b-9151-4e211cd4fe16.description: The Boeing Ethics Ambassador badge earner helps foster our company's culture of compliance and integrity by amplifying our values, listening to the concerns of their peers, identifying pockets of anxiety, and quickly elevating issues to leaders. This badge is for Boeing internal use only.
187ed177-73b6-447b-9151-4e211cd4fe16.name: Boeing Ethics Ambassador

badge_template_activities.title: Boeing employees with at least 1 year at the company.
Employees must be selected through a defined application, interview and vetting process. Boeing site leaders will send communication with application links when the application period is open.
Potential badge earners must actively participate in and complete the 6 hour Ethics Amassador onboarding training program.

3e4c1257-7950-4c69-aa50-65285a5dbde5.description: Badge earners have demonstrated alignment to the Leadership Next (LX) Leadership Philosophies: Service Leadership, Leaders Give Back, Leadership Learning Mindset and Values-Based Leadership. Badge earners have been selected to the program through a robust application process that demonstrates the earner has a high potential to become an Enterprise Leader, Talent Leader and Culture Shaper. This badge is available for Boeing internal use only.
3e4c1257-7950-4c69-aa50-65285a5dbde5.name: Leadership Next Class of 2022

badge_template_activities.title: Successful selection to the program through online application. LXApplication@exchange.boeing.com

Successful review of 4 endorsements: Advocate, Cross-Functional Leader, Manager and Executive. Endorsers will be asked to respond to questions based on the LX Philosophies and High Potential pillars of aspiration, learning agility, leadership and engagement.
Successful selection upon completion of structured interview using 4 questions to learn more about your demonstrated leadership potential as aligned to the LX Philosophies and Boeing Values.

6cecdb78-f16c-47d9-8c49-b5d3aa5ba547.description: The badge earner is able to offer basic labor relations (LR) counsel using knowledge of fundamental LR concepts and activities, identify and potentially help prevent LR risks to the company, and know what to do when potential risks arise. Badge earners are also able to leverage key concepts and strategies to boost employee engagement in the groups they partner with. This badge is available for Boeing internal use only.
6cecdb78-f16c-47d9-8c49-b5d3aa5ba547.name: Labor Relations Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Negotiations/Collective Bargaining - Final Quiz
Positive Employee Relations - Final Quiz
Contract Administration - Final Quiz
International Labor Relations - Final Quiz
Negotiations / Collective Bargaining (Live Session)
Positive Employee Relations (Live Session)
Contract Administration (Live Session)

8a7451e2-296a-4d42-b440-dd83646010a7.description: An APQP Coach succeessfully leads, coaches and mentors teams and practitioners in the creation of PPAP elements. In addition to creating PPAP elements, badge earners have experience reviewing and approving PPAP submissions. An APQP Coach is able to quantify improvements and risk reductions in addition to consistently delivering results. This badge earner is able to make judgements based on criteria and standards. This badge is for Boeing internal use only.
8a7451e2-296a-4d42-b440-dd83646010a7.name: Advanced Product Quality Planning (APQP) Coach

badge_template_activities.title: APQP Coach Degreed pathway
Complete APQP Coach assessment with a score of 80% or better.
Badge earners are evaluated by APQP Business Leads using defined criteria.

b7d5d39f-d0c5-4b23-afc9-68c412979daf.description: Boeing Learning Ambassadors are a community of individuals who are passionate about supporting the development of their colleagues across the world. Our members span 28 countries, represent all of Boeing's business units and act as advocates for our Learning and Development culture. Earners of this badge specifically have been a Learning Ambassador for a minimum of 1 year and help drive the direction of the program by serving on the Leadership team for a minimum of 6 months.
b7d5d39f-d0c5-4b23-afc9-68c412979daf.name: Learning Ambassador Steering Committee

badge_template_activities.title: Learning Ambassador - 2022
Be an active member of the Learning Ambassador Leadership Team for a minimum of 6 months.

d4b8fb9d-9f87-4388-9df0-b27f5f1524ee.description: An APQP Subject Matter Expert demonstrates the ability to innovate procedures and tasks based on experiences. Badge earners advise others on improvements and innovations. An APQP SME is also aboe to review and approve PPAP elements and deliverables. An APQP SME leads special assignments for APQP, participates in external conferences, influences APQP practices and the industry level and leads collaborative teams.
d4b8fb9d-9f87-4388-9df0-b27f5f1524ee.name: Advanced Product Quality Planning (APQP) SME

badge_template_activities.title: APQP SME Degreed pathway
Evaluation performed by APQP Business Leads based on defined criteria.
Advanced Product Quality Planning (APQP) Coach

skills.name: APQP Design Risk Analysis (DRA) / Design Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (DFMEA)
APQP Packaging Preservation and Labeling Approvals
APQP Process Flow Diagram (PFD) / Process Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (PFMEA) / Control Plan (CP)

265c3298-9ea3-4955-9483-8f6e6d6d45b7.description: Earners of the Core Cybersecurity Fundamentals badge are able to articulate and perform fundamental cybersecurity tasks including navigating Linux and Windows operating systems and networks. Badge Earners will identify vulnerabilities, understand basic cloud zero trust fundamentals, integrate threat analysis into action, implement key cybersecurity principles, and will be able to articulate the cybersecurity roles at Boeing and how they interact with each other.
265c3298-9ea3-4955-9483-8f6e6d6d45b7.name: Core Cybersecurity Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Required training for this course includes completing a learning pathway with active participation in required activities, projects, and hands on individual and team exercises.

To earn this badge, the learner must answer technical questions related to each skills labs and projects, take knowledge assessments at each stage of the program, and must demonstrate completion of the core projects required to acquire the badge.

skills.name: Conduct tradeoff analysis of security controls
Scan for vulnerabilities on relevant systems
Scripting automation: bash / python / PowerShell scripting

18c0ae0c-6c47-4db6-9ab7-4f33a210079e.description: Earners of the Cybersecurity Analyst badge can articulate and perform advanced, domain-specific cybersecurity tasks to securely implement and manage systems, monitor and analyze security events, respond to and manage security incidents, assess and manage all aspects of risk, and conduct penetration testing. Badge earners have demonstrated they have cybersecurity knowledge and skills necessary to successfully perform advanced job-related tasks and activities in a cybersecurity role.
18c0ae0c-6c47-4db6-9ab7-4f33a210079e.name: Cybersecurity Analyst

badge_template_activities.title: Cybersecurity Analyst Fundamentals

Verified completion and demonstration of skills through virtual labs, projects, assessments in all 8 advanced learning modules for BTAP Cybersecurity: IAM/IAT Certification Prep, Advanced Monitoring and Logging, Advanced Incident Responder, Cloud Security Analysis, Security Operations Analyst, Advanced Systems Analysis, Risk Management Professional, Network Penetration Tester.

6c125d23-9b52-4551-82c0-e1ce140c8e8c.description: Earners of the Cybersecurity Analyst Fundamentals badge can articulate and perform both fundamental and advanced cybersecurity tasks to secure operating systems and networks, secure systems and applications, evaluate threats, respond to incidents, and manage risk. Badge earners have demonstrated they have cybersecurity knowledge and skills necessary to analyze and evaluate comprehensive security requirements to design and articulate detailed solutions.
6c125d23-9b52-4551-82c0-e1ce140c8e8c.name: Cybersecurity Analyst Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge, the learner must complete an individual capstone report project, a group capstone report project and deliver a report to management. The tasks require knowledge and skills acquired through labs and project at each stage of the program and learners must demonstrate completion of all capstone activities required to earn the badge.
Cybersecurity Secure Systems
Cybersecurity Operations Fundamentals
Core Cybersecurity Fundamentals

8fb89786-5b59-4ec3-bb79-57de0d49dd4d.description: Earners of the Cybersecurity Operations Fundamentals badge are able to articulate and perform fundamental cybersecurity operational tasks including threat management, identify and access, vulnerability management and monitoring and incident response. Badge earners are able to conduct threat indentation and reporting, design and apply appropriate identity and access controls, scan and remediate vulnerabilities in systems and applications, review monitoring applications and logging solutions,
8fb89786-5b59-4ec3-bb79-57de0d49dd4d.name: Cybersecurity Operations Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Required training for this badge includes completing a learning pathway with active participation in required activities, projects, and hands-on individual and team exercises.

To earn this badge, the learner must answer technical questions related to all skills labs and projects, take knowledge assessments at each stage of the program, and must demonstrate completion of the core projects required to acquire the badge.

skills.name: Application of NIST Incident Response Framework
Applying Threat Actor IOCs and TTPs
Vulnerability Scanning and Threat Prioritization for Vulnerability Mitigation

a1bfbe2d-04e2-421a-b9b7-d6ae3f954dbf.description: Earners of this badge are able to perform cybersecurity tasks to secure and protect applications and systems, including risk management, secure application development, malware analysis, and application of system standards. They are able to conduct risk assessments, develop secure software development processes & lifecycles, reverse engineer & analyze suspicious software and malware, audit systems for weaknesses, and analyze penetration testing and security reports to develop mitigation plans.
a1bfbe2d-04e2-421a-b9b7-d6ae3f954dbf.name: Cybersecurity Secure Systems

badge_template_activities.title: Required training for this course includes completing a learning pathway with active participation in required activities, projects and hands on individual and team activities.

To earn this badge, the learner must answer technical questions related to each skills labs and projects, take knowledge assessments at each stage of the program and must demonstrate completion of the core projects required to acquire the badge.

skills.name: Application Development using Security Best Practices
Apply STIGS controls to conduct System Hardening tasks
Auditing applications using Open Web Application Security Project Security Standards
Audits using Compliance standards including FISMA
Conducting Reverse Engineering and Malware Analysis
Designing and implementing DevSecOps and SecDevOps standards
Implementation of the NIST Risk Management Framework

fcdf95cf-527c-4835-a3b1-67eaf67ac7bf.description: Earners of the IXE Tier 1 Badge are able to understand the effects of their engineering work "down stream" when their designs are put into use. They are knowledgeable on BCA production and maintenance requirements in the areas of Production, Supply Chain and Customer Support and have a deeper technical breadth across the value chain that's aligned to the “π-shaped” engineer initiative. This badge is for Boeing internal use only.
fcdf95cf-527c-4835-a3b1-67eaf67ac7bf.name: BCA Immersive Experiences for Engineers (IXE) Tier 1

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners must complete the required learning activities outlined in the Core, Production, Supply Chain and Customers pathways under the BCA Immersive Experience Degreed plan.
Badge earners must successfully pass the BCA Immersive Experience Tier 1 knowledge assessment with a score of 80% or better.

skills.name: Boeing Customer Support Operations Center & Boneyard (Seal Beach) Fundamentals
Field Service Representatives Day in a Life

747c9f96-d2f0-4da7-bf7f-a9646a6db931.description: The APQP PFD/PFMEA/Control Plan Practitioner leads APQP project teams and is responsible for maintaining and submitting the PFD/PFMEA/Control Plan in support of APQP. The APQP Practitioner demonstrates application of APQP through learning the creation of PFD/PFMEA/Control Plan. Badge earners are acknowledged as being able to articulate how the PFD/PFMEA/Control Plan influenced other PPAP elements. This badge is available for Boeing internal use only.
747c9f96-d2f0-4da7-bf7f-a9646a6db931.name: APQP PFD/PFMEA/Control Plan

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the APQP PFD/PFMEA/Control Plan Practitioner Degreed pathway.

Performance is validated by Business Unit APQP Leads using defined criteria.

Badge earners are acknowledged as being able to articulate how the FAIR influenced other PPAP elements. This badge is available for Boeing internal use only.

cd9292d2-3b87-4119-a58c-6fee9a52b67c.description: The APQP Packaging, Preservation, and Labeling Approvals Practitioner leads APQP project teams and is responsible for maintaining and submitting these approvals in support of APQP. The APQP Practitioner demonstrates application of APQP through learning the creation of Packaging, Preservation, and Labeling Approvals. 7ae9aa99-27a4-48f9-b4bf-4764673cb556.description: The User-Centered Design (UCD) Guide badge earner is able to guide teams in applying the User-Centered Design framework and tools. Badge earners are able to inspire and coach others in the use of UCD methods and tools, so project teams can effectively leverage the UCD framework to creatively solve problems with solutions desirable to users. This badge is currently offered internal to Boeing only.
7ae9aa99-27a4-48f9-b4bf-4764673cb556.name: User-Centered Design Guide

badge_template_activities.title: User-Centered Design Advocate
User-Centered Design Practitioner
Badge earners will generally have 1-2 years experience applying User-Centered Design to projects and coaching/guiding others on applying UCD.
Potential badge earners are evaluated by the UCD Badge Review Board members using defined criteria. Evaluation will include interview, 360 feedback and direct observation.
